ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I have never spent so long with a set of intellectual ideasthe full-year essay process had its ups and downs, but I'm so glad I committed to one subject for so long. Biggest (semi-serious) takeaway: never EVER leave your bibliography for the final day.
Working on essay with Professor Roffman has been a true delight. She is an amazing teacher devoted to making my thesis the sharpest it can be.
It was my first try at sustained independent scholarly research. I really enjoyed the opportunity!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The document with all the thesis information could be organized better and contain more information about formatting. I also think the timeline section is confusing.

Strengths: it's due early, so it doesn't dominate your whole April. Flip side is that it is due really, really soon after spring break. An earlier draft deadline and/or a later final due date would be helpful.

There was truly such a lack of help for people writing their senior essay. I often emailed several times to get one simple answer, office hours were not specific or engaging, and Paul offered very little help or guidance, even when asked for it. He often spent far more time in office hours, and getting drinks, with the male students and did little more than "chat" instead of offering guidance.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I loved writing my thesis, and I am so proud of the work I did. I definitely recommend doing a two semester thesis because you have more time to research and write, and more time to get feedback from your advisor.

Everyone in the HUMS major is wonderful, and the senior essay is an amazing chance to bring together some of the things that have most excited you in your studies. However, make sure that you are set up for success with an advisor who will pay attention to the relatively lax, nebulous, and fluid HUMS senior essay guidelines and help you be successful within them. Also make sure to have a clarifying conversation about what a senior essay is and is not so that you don't have unnecessary stress by striving toward something that is not even expected of you.
Yes! The professors and major are great.

Take the two-semester thesis! The best thing you can do as a Yale senior is to confront the challenge of sustaining independent work in free/unstructured time. Use the free time it gives you to execute the project that you have always wanted to do, not something that you could get in the way of classes.
